channel.title: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)
channel.description:
The code is [code]hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);[/code]
What does the 4 represent? and what does the 20 represent? Could it be accuracy and max hit? Or somthing else? Thanks.

item.title: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.source: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)

item.title: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

You’d need to implement that the way I explained.

There isn’t any magic method or variable to set to change the likelihood of a miss.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

misc.random 20 (numbers 0-19, length of 20), + the value of 4. so it’s basically 4-23

item.title: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

aka it the lowest it can hit is 4 then it will have a choice of adding + hitting a number of 20 to the 4
4 + random number = your hit
4 + 16 = 20

easier words lol

  • = addition
    / = division
  • = multiplication
  • = subtraction

Read full topic
item.source: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)

item.title: Help with one super simple code (hitDiff = 4 + misc.random(20);)
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

misc.random(arg); takes in an upper-bound as its argument and selects a number randomly from 0-arg. The 4 is just added to present a lower bound and a higher upper bound; whatever the result of misc.random is, we add 4 to it.

As for what hitDiff is, I can’t remember.

Read full topic
